questions.uddipok:
Read the passage and write the antonym or synonym of the words as directed.
A cook once roasted a duck for his master. The roast looked so (a) delicious (use a synonym) that the cook couldn't resist the temptation and ate up one of the drumsticks. When his master sat down to eat he quickly noticed the missing leg and asked what had (b) happened (use a synonym) to the other leg. The cook told him that the duck had one leg only. The master was not to be fooled. He said that there was no such thing as a one-legged duck. The cook (c) insisted (use an antonym) that this duck really had only one leg. The master was very (d) annoyed (use a synonym) with the (e) stubbornness (use a synonym) of the cook and threatened to (f) fire (use an antonym) another man for his job. (g) Right (use a synonym) at that moment, the cook looked out of the window and saw some ducks resting outside in the courtyard. One of the ducks was standing on one leg and had the other leg folded inside. He drew the attention of his master and showed him that some ducks did (h) indeed (use a synonym) have one leg. The master clapped his hands loudly which (i) startled (use a synonym) the duck. It put down its other leg as well and ran off. The master looked at the cook. The (j) cook (use a synonym) replied quietly that his master was right after all if he had known this trick he would have clapped his hands too before cooking to bring out the other leg. The master wasn't very (k) amused (use an antonym) by the ready (l) wit (use a synonym) of the cook and said that he would (m) forgive (use a synonym) him this time (n) because (use a synonym) it was the first time. But he did not want to see any more one-legged ducks on his table in future.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) delicious → tasty (synonym)
(b) happened → occurred (synonym)
(c) insisted → denied (antonym)
(d) annoyed → irritated (synonym)
(e) stubbornness → obstinacy (synonym)
(f) fire → hire (antonym)
(g) right → correct (synonym)
(h) indeed → truly (synonym)
(i) startled → shocked (synonym)
(j) cook → chef (synonym)
(k) amused → serious (antonym)
(l) wit → cleverness (synonym)
(m) forgive → pardon (synonym)
(n) because → since (synonym)

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph (within 200 words) on the topic The Advantages of Rural Life, Your paragraph must contain answers to the following questions. (a) What's rural life? (b) What are the advantages of rural life? (c) How do they differ from urban life?

sub_questions.explanation:
The Advantages of Rural Life
Rural life means village life. It has two major advantages. The main feature of rural life is peacefulness and the other is naturalness. Life in a village, is calm and quiet and uneventful (গতানুগতিক). Villagers do not suffer from tension. In a village the air is free from pollution. In the village, one gets fresh air, vegetables, fruits and fish. One can swim and walk without fear of accidents as in the city. These are not available in urban life and this makes the rural life different from the urban life. Although electricity has reached many villages, most of the urban amenities (সুযোগ-সুবিধা) are still absent. But the environment in rural life is fresh and clean and the people are friendly and.generous. In rural life, people lead a much simpler life close to nature. The farmers who are the core factors of agriculture live in villages. They produce rice and other crops working from the early morning till evening. One can get pure water, presh fruits, vegetables, fish, milk and meat in villages. Rural life is free from the din and bustle of city life. The pollution levels are much lower and social values still prevail (বিরাজ ক্করা) in rural life. Rural life and urban life are totally different from each other. The status of rural life can be developed by the way of increasing the infrastructural facilities as well as employment opportunities.

questions.uddipok: Write a comparison and contrast paragraph (within 200 words) on the topic "Pahela Boishakh and the Other Festivals."

sub_questions.explanation:
Pahela Boishakh and the Other Festivals
Pahela Boishakh is the first day of Bangla year which becomes a popular festival (উৎসব) in Bangladesh. This is the first day of the year. In fact, it is a Bangla new year's day which comes annually and is celebrated all over the country with great fun and frolic. Pahela Boishakh is a national festival in Bangladesh which is celebrated all over the country. All the people of our country take' part in this festival, irrespective (নির্বিশেষে ) of caste, creed and religion. They celebrate this day with great enthusiasm. In fact, it is secular in nature. Besides, there are other festivals and they are too numerous to mention. Some of them are religious festivals and some of them are historical. Eid-ul-Fitr and Eid-ul-Azha are the biggest religious festivals of the Muslims. Similarly. the Hindus celebrate the Durga puja, the Saraswati puja, the Lakshmi puja and the Kali puja. The Christmas festival is the main religious festival of the Christians while the Buddha Purnima is the main festival of the Buddhists. These festivals are celebrated for the religious purpose, but Pahela Boishakh is a secular (লোকায়ত) festival. Every religious. group celebrates this festival. The historical festivals include the celebration of the 21 st February, the Independence Day and the Victory Day. These days are celebrated all over the country in a befitting manner and inspire the people with a high sense of patriotism. Among all the festivals. Pahela Boishakh has a special salience (বৈশিষ্ট) the people of Bangladesh. This festival is marked as a rich culture of our country. In fact, Pahela Boishakh and other festivals are an occasion of great festivity. Our countrymen observe these festivals with great ecstasy.
